titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the University Club of Brooklyn records 1973.190
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:12:01 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The University Club of Brooklyn records consist of a small assortment of materials documenting the activities of the Club during the period 1904 to 1952.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The University Club of Brooklyn was incorporated in 1901 as a social club for "college-trained men of Brooklyn." It became less active after the loss of its clubhouse at Lafayette and Oxford Streets in 1931. The University Club dissolved in 1952.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The University Club of Brooklyn records consist of a small assortment of materials documenting the activities of the Club during the period 1904 to 1952. Materials chiefly consist of correspondence, though additional items include the Club's certificates of incorporation and dissolution, a membership list, minutes of annual meetings, news clippings, programs, and yearbooks.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); University Club of Brooklyn records, 1973.190, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
